headline: First Solar Stock Falls Hard on Tariff Hit
summary: First Solar  the country’s largest solar manufacturer, said that tariffs will significantly reduce revenue and earnings this year, sending the stock down 10% in after-hours trading.  First Solar  missed Wall Street’s consensus expectation for the first quarter, reporting earnings of $1.95 a share versus the projection of $2.49 a share.  It said that tariffs could reduce its 2025 revenue from a range of $5.3 billion to $5.8 billion to a range of $4.5 billion to $5.5 billion.

headline: First Solar (FSLR) Q1 Earnings and Revenues Miss Estimates
summary: First Solar (FSLR) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -22% and 0.73%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: First Solar stock drops on earnings, lowered full-year guidance
summary: First Solar (FSLR) issued first quarter earnings that fell short of Wall Street estimates. The solar company also lowered its full-year sales and earnings guidance.  Market Domination Overtime Anchors Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton report the breaking numbers. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) Posts Q1 Sales In Line With Estimates But Stock Drops
summary: Solar panel manufacturer First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales up 6.4% year on year to $844.6 million. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $5 billion at the midpoint came in 8.9% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $1.95 per share was 22.1% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: First Solar: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Tempe, Arizona-based company said it had profit of $1.95. The results did not meet Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $2.50 per share.

headline: First Solar, Inc. Announces First Quarter 2025 Financial Results and Revises Guidance to Reflect Expected Impact of Implementation of New Tariffs
summary: TEMPE, Ariz., April 29, 2025--First Solar, Inc. (Nasdaq: FSLR) (the "Company") today announced financial results for the first quarter ended March 31, 2025, and issued revised guidance to reflect the expected impact of the implementation of new tariffs in April 2025.

headline: Latest News In Energy Transition - Innovative Energy Storage Empowers California Health Center
summary: Recent developments in the energy transition landscape spotlight the awarding of a $10 million grant by the California Energy Commission to Quino Energy and Long Hill Energy Partners. This funding will enable the demonstration of an 8 MWh organic flow battery system at a regional health center in California, marking the first U.S. commercial deployment of Quino Energy's technology. The project aims to provide critical energy resilience and significantly reduce electricity costs while...
